title: Python Basic Syntax
body: The Python language has many similarities to Perl, C, and Java. However, there are some definite differences between the languages. title: Python Variable Types
body: Variables are nothing but reserved memory locations to store values. This means that when you create a variable you reserve some space in memory. Based on the data type of a variable, the interpreter allocates memory and decides what can be stored in the reserved memory. Therefore, by assigning different data types to variables, you can store integers, decimals or characters in these variables.

title: Python Basic Operators
body: Operators are the constructs which can manipulate the value of operands. Consider the expression 4 + 5 = 9. Here, 4 and 5 are called operands and + is called operator. Types of Operator Python language supports the following types of operators.
